entry.title: hexo theme
entry.content:
Hello!

This blog is to continue personal website establishment on the basis of what has been implemented in “establishment tutorial”.

Here, I am going to introduce you how to use a hexo theme to make your website charming.

Select Your Favorite Theme

Themes,

You can go to the following link to select a theme from official website.

https://hexo.io/themes/

Then, access to the author’s Github project.

Git Clone,

Git clone into your themes file under root repository

Localization

Path,

Back to _config.yml under your blog (not inside themes),

replace the theme name by what you have downloaded.

Regeneration,

hexo clean,

hexo g,

hexo s,

Now, go to localhost and see the changes.

The format of your website should be same as the one you selected.

Personalization

If you choose to use a official theme, the author’s project usually offers README.md to guide you how to recognize and modify its configuration. Please read it carefully and try it as much as possible.

Music,

You may have noticed there are two tests are created as individual blogs in Progranoob Web. They are in-text insertion realization.

If you want to add it into your page, type in the command below into your theme _config.yml

If you want to insert a in-text music, please copy and paste iframe link like below.

live2d,

npm install –save hexo-helper-live2d

When finished, check whether node_modules is under your blog file.

Then, type in configurations inside the _config.yml,

It doesn’t matter where you place it as long as you don’t insert it between dependent lines.

Deploy

Remember to deploy it into your io by hexo d

Wait for a few seconds and hope a brand-new blog style is recreated.

Reference:

entry.title: establishment tutorial
entry.content:
Hello!

This blog will exhibit the basic process of the establishment of a hexo-based personal website. Hope the following instructions can help you.

Preparations:

(If you are a mac user, roll down to Reference to see the first video)

Before running into hexo environment, you need to download nodejs, hexo and a .md file compiler.

node.js,

click https://nodejs.org/en/download/, and you will see,

Click an appropriate version (LTS is recommended) for your computer.

PS: Some bloggers said node version should not be very high, but for me, it works well.

You are supposed to install node.js and npm within this step.

When you finished, open your cmd and type in npm -v and node -v to check your downloaded version. If successful, it shows:

Hexo,

Still in cmd, (If you wish to download in Disk D or E or … , just open cmd inside where you want)

type in the command below:

npm install -g hexo

When you finished, use hexo -v to check your installation. If successful, it shows:

.md Compiler,

Here two are recommended: MarkDownPad2 and Typora

I choose typora here, because MarkDownPad2 needs secret keys.

If time is available, I will write another blog to introduce how to use typora and write html codes inside it. However, an alternative way is to read the second link in Reference to get you familiar with this excellent software.

Establishment: (All command in cmd)

Create a Blog,

Under a favorable path, type in:

md blog

Then, you can see a file named blog is created.

Create a default page,

Then go into blog file, type in:

cd blog,

hexo init,

After installation finished, type in:

hexo s,

You are expected to see a feedback below.

Now, you can type localhost:4000 in any browser to see what is going to happen!

You should see a “hello world” default page created for you.

Create a new Blog,

Press Ctrl+C to exit.

type in:

hexo n **”intro”**or hexo new “intro” (intro can be replaced by any name as you like)

Then, use .md compiler to write something inside your intro.md file. (vim is also okay if you are a mac user)

Save and come back to cmd.

Now, type in:

hexo clean,

hexo g,

hexo s,

Now, you can type localhost:4000 in any browser to see what is going to happen!

You are expected to see a new blog is created above “hello world”.

Connected to your Github

Create a permanent path,

Then, login in your github account and create a new repository.

Write in the form of nickname.github.io

Press Create repository.

Install deployer,

Back to cmd, type in:

npm install hexo-deployer-git –save

Ignore all the warnings.

Modify _config.yml,

Use .md compiler(typora) to modify _config.yml inside the blog file

Add deploy information at the end of this .yml file

Then, inside cmd, set your git global

git config –global user.name

git config –global user.email

Next, type in:

hexo d,

to deploy into Github. You need to login in your Github account to confirm.

Check,

After deployer finishes, you can try nickname.github.io to see your website.

Please wait patiently for a few seconds.

Congratulations!

Now, you can see your localhost page has been uploaded into your Github website!

Reference: (In same order of steps)
